title: Implement MCP to_native converter for Goose
description:
Implement mcp_to_native() for Goose.

## IMPORTANT: Use McpCapabilities Validation

Before converting, validate with `supports_mcp_server()`:

```rust
pub fn mcp_to_native(harness: &Harness, name: &str, server: &McpServer) -> Result<serde_json::Value> {
    if !harness.supports_mcp_server(server) {
        return Err(Error::UnsupportedMcpConfig {
            harness: harness.kind().to_string(),
            reason: "Server uses unsupported features".into(),
        });
    }
    // ... conversion logic
}
```

This catches cases like:
- HTTP server with OAuth (Goose doesn't support OAuth)

## Goose MCP Format
- Uses type: stdio/sse/streamable_http
- cmd not command
- envs not env
- uri not url
- timeout in seconds not ms
- Requires name and description fields

- [ ] Validates with supports_mcp_server() before converting
- [ ] Returns Result<Value, Error>
- [ ] Converts timeout_ms to seconds
- [ ] Uses cmd/envs/uri field names
- [ ] Unit tests cover validation failures (e.g., OAuth rejected)

title: Epic: API Refactor for Multi-Harness Resource Management
description:
Complete API refactor to properly support MCP, skills, commands, plugins, and rules across Claude Code, OpenCode, and Goose harnesses.

## Goals
- Distinguish between directory-based resources (skills, commands, plugins) and config-embedded resources (MCP)
- Provide normalized types with harness-specific converters
- Support environment variable references with harness-specific syntax
- Capture structural differences (e.g., skill vs skills, singular vs nested directories)
- Include exists field for installation checking

## Key Design Decisions
- Use Result<Option<Resource>> pattern: Err=system error, None=unsupported, Some=supported
- Enum + Match wrapper for Harness (Option 1 with enhancements)
- Normalized MCP types with to_native/from_native converters
- EnvValue type for  vs {env:VAR} syntax differences

## Harnesses
- Claude Code: ~/.claude/, .claude/
- OpenCode: ~/.config/opencode/, .opencode/
- Goose: ~/.config/goose/, .goose/

## Research Completed
- MCP schemas verified for all harnesses
- Skills paths verified (skill vs skills, nested structure)
- Plugins vs MCP distinction clarified for OpenCode

title: Define MCP normalized types
description:
Define the normalized MCP server types that work across all harnesses.

## McpServer Enum

```rust
#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
#[serde(tag = "transport", rename_all = "snake_case")]
pub enum McpServer {
    Stdio(StdioMcpServer),
    Sse(SseMcpServer),
    Http(HttpMcpServer),
}
```

## StdioMcpServer

```rust
#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct StdioMcpServer {
    pub command: String,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "Vec::is_empty")]
    pub args: Vec<String>,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "HashMap::is_empty")]
    pub env: HashMap<String, EnvValue>,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")]
    pub cwd: Option<PathBuf>,
    #[serde(default = "default_true")]
    pub enabled: bool,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")]
    pub timeout_ms: Option<u64>,
}
```

## SseMcpServer (for SSE transport)

```rust
#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct SseMcpServer {
    pub url: String,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "HashMap::is_empty")]
    pub headers: HashMap<String, EnvValue>,
    #[serde(default = "default_true")]
    pub enabled: bool,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")]
    pub timeout_ms: Option<u64>,
}
```

## HttpMcpServer (for Streamable HTTP transport)

```rust
#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct HttpMcpServer {
    pub url: String,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "HashMap::is_empty")]
    pub headers: HashMap<String, EnvValue>,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")]
    pub oauth: Option<OAuthConfig>,
    #[serde(default = "default_true")]
    pub enabled: bool,
    #[serde(default, skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")]
    pub timeout_ms: Option<u64>,
}
```
